description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the Windows Kerberos elevation of privilege vulnerability (CVE-2024-38239):

1. Identify which version of Windows you are running.
2. Download the appropriate update package from the official Microsoft Update Catalog based on your build number:
   - For Windows 11 Version 24H2 for x64-based Systems, apply KB5043080.
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2 for x64-based Systems, apply KB5043076.
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2 for x64-based Systems, apply KB5043064.
   - For older systems, suitable updates include KB5043067 and KB5043083 (Windows 10).
3. Install the downloaded updates.
4. Restart your system after installation to ensure all changes take effect.

**Details**:
- This update resolves a weak authentication issue allowing elevation of privilege in Windows Kerberos.
- For manual installation, find the updates here:
  - [KB5043080](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043080)
  - [KB5043076](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043076)
  - [KB5043064](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043064)
  - [KB5043067](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043067)
  - [KB5043083](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043083)

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure your system is updated to one of the specified build numbers prior to applying the updates.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the update installation.
